Selected Answer: D
D. a type of audit occurring during the project is an accurate description of a gate review.

A gate review is a formal review that is conducted at various stages of a project to assess the progress and viability of the project. It is typically conducted by a panel of experts who review the project documentation, assess the project's alignment with the organization's goals and objectives, and evaluate the project's risks and challenges. The purpose of a gate review is to ensure that the project is on track and that it is meeting the necessary standards of quality and performance.

The PMO (Project Management Office) is responsible for supporting and coordinating the organization's projects and ensuring that they are delivered on time and within budget. When the finance director asks the PMO for help gathering a group of specialists to work in an operations center, the PMO is likely to take action to support this request. One possible action that the PMO may take is to request funding to hire the group of specialists.

questions.answer_description: The quantitative risk management is the process of converting the impact of risk of the project into numerical terms.
questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of quantitative risk management?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Quantitative risk management entails assessing and prioritizing risks based on their potential impact and likelihood of occurrence. Annual loss expectancy (ALE) is a popular quantitative risk management metric for calculating the expected financial loss from a risk in a given year. The expected monetary loss from an incident is multiplied by the probability of that incident occurring within a year in this calculation.
